text: The Barcelona Metro (Catalan and Spanish: Metro de Barcelona), part of the public transportation system of Barcelona, Spain is an extensive network of electrified railways that run underground in central Barcelona and above ground into the city's suburbs. There are 189 stations with 12 lines together with 166 km of total track line. The network length is 170 kilometres, with 183 stations, as of November 2021. == Lines == Line Number Termini Operator Current Length Approved Length Current Stations Approved Stations Year of Opening Image:L1 barcelona.svg|25x25px rect 0 0 500 500 Barcelona Metro line 1 desc none Hospital de Bellvitge - Fondo TMB 20,700 km 29,758 km 29 38 1929 Image:L2 barcelona.svg|25x25px rect 0 0 500 500 Barcelona Metro line 2 desc none Paral·lel - Badalona Pompeu Fabra TMB 13,100 km 18,466 km 17 34 1959 Image:L3 barcelona.svg|25x25px rect 0 0 500 500 Barcelona Metro line 3 desc none Zona Universitària - Trinitat Nova TMB 18,400 km 20,024 km 26 36 1924 Image:L4 barcelona.svg|25x25px rect 0 0 500 500 Barcelona Metro line 4 desc none Trinitat Nova - La Pau TMB 16,700 km 18,916 km 22 26 1926 Image:L5 barcelona.svg|25x25px rect 0 0 500 500 Barcelona Metro line 5 desc none Cornellà Centre - Vall d'Hebron TMB 16,700 km 19,168 km 23 27 1959 Image:L6 barcelona.svg|25x25px rect 0 0 500 500 Barcelona Metro line 6 desc none Pl.
